subject: Add service file for creating hostboot dump directory
commitMessage:
Add service file for creating hostboot dump directory

If hostboot dump is enabled then hostboot dump directory needs
to be created before starting the dump manager.
The dump manager start watching on the dump directory
and if that is not present dump manager object can't be
created.
Add new service in openpower dump extension to create the directory.
recipe changes for this service:
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/42327
Tests:
   Created an image and made sure phosphor-dump-manager is
started with hostboot dump support.
   An entry is created when a new dump is present in the
given directory.

Signed-off-by: Dhruvaraj Subhashchandran <dhruvaraj@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ia51c9d22fe429a57d024b121f97b4cffd28a7703

Please add related service link creation patch info
Done
If what is enabled ?
if openpower dumps are enabled.. will add that
Do you need to add test case details ?
will add the tests

Is it your intension to make service file name and description in generic ?
Because, you are creating folder for hostboot dump but, you mentioned like openpower dumps and I guess openpower having other type of dump right ?
yes in future we can use this service for creating folders for other openpower dumps too

Service file installation should go into base meson file because, below code (LN from 17 to 30) are common to any service file. 
So, please move below code into base meson file and In this meson just append your service file name.
E.x 
```
unit_files += [
        'create_openpower_dump_dirs.service'
     ]
```
Done

I'm a little confused on why the application can't just create this directory? Seems a bit over board to need a service for this?
Also, similar comment on why the ".in" extension is needed?

.in still need to find
this directory is needed before starting the app, similarly the BMC dump also getting created as part of the dump manager service
Done
Probably can just do /bin/mkdir vs. the /bin/sh -c
Done
Does this really get expanded into the service file during build time?
yes

What will happen if not creating?
I thinking why service file instead create by respective dump manager?
the watch is started on the dump manager if not created the dump manager creating will fail

Which dump manager? For each dump, we have a separate manager, right? In the recent refactor patch for handling bmc stored dump type, I am seeing like a watch is added in phosphor::dump::bmc_stored::Manager class and it is derived in hostboot dump manger so why we cannot create the directory before hostboot dump manager initialization i.e either in base dump manager constructor (I am preferring this one) or in loadExtensions() function? - I am missing something?

For me, looks like we are designing like should have a service file for each extended dump in PDC so future we will see many service files just for creating a directory right? - I am trying to see whether we avoid that in PDC.
Better to handle directory creation in the respective extension functions?
Done
Create OpenPOWER dump folders to store packaged dumps?
Done
Why can not hostboot dump manager create this directory rather than service file?
This file needed before starting the dump manager
Added some suggestion regarding this in another comment.
removing this file
